turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Trustkill Records.
turn.1: What happened with Trustkill Records in 2008?
turn.2: The band left the label with hopes that Trustkill could fix itself and stated, "we hope that by making this situation public, Josh will be motivated to get his business in order and set things right with Throwdown and everyone else who has been burned by the increasingly difficult situation." Memphis May Fire were once signed to Trustkill and later Grabelle's Bullet Tooth.
turn.3: Did anyone else have any issues with Trustkill?
turn.4: The band's song "The Victim" that appears on 2011's The Hollow talks about "much darker times" during their time signed to Trustkill Records.
turn.5: What are some of the lyrics of the song?
turn.6: " The Victim" includes the lines "If I could go back/ do it all again/ you know that I wouldn't sign my life away".
turn.7: What other problems did the band have with Trustkill?
turn.8: Before introducing the song the band has called Trustkill a "shitty label" and have said that they are now proud to be a part of Rise Records.
turn.9: Did the band have any other songs that talked about their problems with the label?
turn.10: The lyrics of the song "Prove Me Right", off album, "Challenger" discuss the band's struggles with the record label retrospectively. " The Rose", from "Unconditional", contains similar content.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: In late 2010, Nick Brooks and Mike Hatalak of It Dies Today formed a new group called The March.
